perturbation.original_text: Channel Partner accepts iPass as the exclusive provider to Channel Partner for all services of the nature of the Services. In no event may Channel Partner resell or otherwise provide the Service to any third party for purposes of further "down channel" resale of the Services, absent iPass' notice and consent.
perturbation.changed_text: Channel Partner accepts iPass as the exclusive provider to Channel Partner for certain services. In no event may Channel Partner resell or otherwise provide the Service to any third party for purposes of further "down channel" resale of the Services, absent iPass' notice and consent.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'all services of the nature of the Services' to 'certain services' creates ambiguity. It's unclear which services iPass is the exclusive provider for. This creates a contradiction because later sections may assume exclusivity for all services, leading to uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Channel Partner agrees that it will not (and will not permit Business Entities) to use the Service in a manner contrary to the iPass acceptable use policy located at http://www3.ipass.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/01/Acceptable-Use-Policy.pdf/ , and incorporated herein by reference.
perturbation.changed_text: Channel Partner agrees that it will not (and will not permit Business Entities) to misuse the Service. Channel Partner agrees to adhere to general industry standards of acceptable use.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to the specific iPass acceptable use policy, and replacing with 'general industry standards of acceptable use,' the definition of 'acceptable use' becomes vague. The original text clearly points to a specific document, which is now omitted, and replaced with a ambiguous statement, which creates a contradiction if later sections refer to specifics within the original AUP, or expect strict adherence to the original AUP.

perturbation.original_text: iPass may change the pricing in Exhibit C upon notice to Channel Partner, such changes to be effective within thirty (30) days after the date of such notice, such changes may include, by way of example only, the application of end of life fees.
perturbation.changed_text: iPass may change the pricing upon notice to Channel Partner, such changes to be effective within thirty (30) days after the date of such notice.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'such changes may include, by way of example only, the application of end of life fees', removes the explicit mention of end-of-life fees being a possible price change. If end-of-life fees are introduced later without specific agreement or a separate contractual section outlining them, it could create a contradiction since the modified clause doesn't clearly encompass them. Later sections calculating profits could have uncertainty.
